model_id: Unique identifier for all the PDXs derived from the same tissue sample
provider_type: Type of PDX provider, either academia or industry (CRO, pharma)
accessibility: Define any limitation of access of the model per type of users like academia only, industry and academia, or national limitation if needed (e.g. no specific consent for sequencing)
europdx_access_modality: If part of EUROPDX consortium fill this in. Designates a model is accessible for transnational access through the EDIReX infrastructure, or only on a collaborative basis (i.e. upon approval of the proposed project by the owner of the model)
email: Contact email for any requests from users about models. If multiple, include as comma separated list.
name: Contact person (should match that included in email column).
form_url: If the center has a contact form rather than a contact email include the link here.
database_url: If institution has a public database and want that link to be shared, include here
provider_name: The full name of the data provider/institutiuon - will be displayed as a data source name
provider_abbreviation: Data provider abbreviation/acronym - will be use in URLs  within PDX Finder.
project: Include the project name if the data provider belongs to a larger project/consortium.

provider_type: academia,industry, academia and industry, CRO, pharma
accessibility: academia, industry and academia or free text
europdx_access_modality: transnational access,  collaboration only, or leave empty
name: free text
provider_name: free text - please do not acceed 30 characters including spaces
provider_abbreviation: free text - we will check that the abbreviation is compatible with our processes and may have to change  the abbreviation accordingly - do not include those characters: space, \ / : * ? " < > | & % . ' # [ ] + =  , _
